subsections.title: BSc. in CSE
subsections.subtitle: United International University
description: **Currently writing a conference paper on my finished capstone project that aims to allow disabled people to browse the Internet more effortlessly.

subsections.title: Harvard's Web Programming with Python and Javascript
description: I am trying to learn how to make web projects _scalable_ from this online course on the [edx.org](https://edx.org) platform. This course is being offered as an MOOC from the _Harvard University_.

subsections.title: dark-toggle
description: A _shell_ script (for the Linux and BSD Operating Systems) that automatically toggles between the light adn dark variants of the currently active _System_ and _Applications_ theme.

subsections.title: Subtitle-DL
description: A python script that fetches subtitles of _any movie_ from [opensubtitles.org](opensubtitles.org) by consuming their REST API. Can be used in CLI, or as a backend for GUI and web-based programs.

subsections.title: A webapp that fetches book ratings from Goodreads.com
description: This is a webapp that I made as a project for _Harvard's CS50x Web Programming_ online course (the course is still ongoing).

subsections.title: A Wikipedia clone
description: This is a simple web-app that partially imitates the functionality of Wikipedia.org. Anyone can _add_ and _modify_ existing pages using _Markdown_ (instead of _wikitext_)

subsections.title: My GitHub
description: Further projects (finished/unfinished), some algorithm implementations in C, and a word vectorizer written in Python in my GitHub profile:

subsections.title: Source Code contributions
subsections.subtitle: I3IPC-Python
description: The 'i3ipc-python' is an Inter-Process Communication (IPC) library for interacting with the tiling window managers 'i3wm' and 'Sway WM' for the GNU/Linux desktop
I have two _accepted_ **Pull Requests** to the main project rep currently:
1. _https://github.com/altdesktop/i3ipc-python/issues/170_: The ‘SwayWM’ version of the library was missing an API that returns all GUI windows belonging to a given app by name.
2. _https://github.com/altdesktop/i3ipc-python/issues/172_: The same framework was also missing an API that was part of the SwayWM’s IPC speciﬁcations, so I implemented it.

subsections.title: Volunteering at the Mozilla Foundation
description: I was one of the core volunteers of the Mozilla Bangladesh team. For my contributions to Mozilla’s ultimate mission of the “Open Web”, I was ﬂown (free of cost) to San Francisco, California, USA, to attend the Mozilla Summit 2013.
More about the kinds of activities that I did as a volunteer:
